titleStmt.title: A pleasant comedy, called A mayden-head well lost As it hath beene publickly acted at the Cocke-pit in Drury-lane, with much applause: by her Maiesties Seruants. Written by Thomas Heyvvood.
Maidenhead well lost
titleStmt.author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Nicholas Okes for Iohn Iackson and Francis Church, and are to be sold at the Kings Armes in Cheape-side,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A mayden-head well lost.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
